page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: ECOLOGICALLY, WHITSOME IS ONE OF THE MOST ALTERED AREAS OF SCOTLAND. FIVE THOUSAND YEARS AGO IT WOULD BE COVERED BY DECIDUOUS WOOD _ OAK, ASH, ELM ON DRY DRUMLINS, ALDER AND WILLOW ON MARSHY AREAS. NOW, BECAUSE THE GROUND WAS MUCH FOUGHT OVER AND BURNT IN THE WARS OF INDEPENDENCE AND IS SO GOOD FOR ARABLE FARMING, MOST OF THE TREES AND FLOWERS OF PERMANENT GRASSLAND HAVE GONE. THE WILD HABITATS ARE ALONG THE HORNDEAN BURN, NEWTOWN QUARRY AND SOME OLD TRACKWAYS AND BURNS. IN THIS SURVEY WE COUNTED 170 PLANTS, 20 ANIMALS AND 20 BIRDS ROUND THE WOODLANDS, FARMS AND VILLAGE. THE MOST INTERESTING AREA, NEWTOWN QUARRY, HAS AT LEAST THREE PLANTS RARE IN SCOTLAND.
